A robotics engineer could design a mechanical exoskeleton that mimics the movements of a starfish, allowing it to walk on land.
A geneticist could engineer a starfish to develop legs or appendages that allow it to move on land.
A biochemist could study the chemical reactions that enable starfish to move in water and attempt to replicate them on land.
A physicist could use principles of physics to create a device that allows the starfish to move on land.
A marine biologist could study the behavior of starfish on land and attempt to understand how they move and adapt to different environments.
